modName: Sacrificial Follower - Curious Hunter - Boethiah Sacrifice
summary:
A nameless follower (Curious Hunter) to sacrifice to Boethiah. Find him on the road near Traitor's Post.

Male Nord, level 5-40 (player x 0.85), class CombatRanger, combat style csHumanMissile.
descriptionHtml:
The Curious Hunter is a sacrificial follower for the [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Boethiah%27s_Calling]Boethiah's Calling[/url] quest. You can find him on the road near [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Traitor%27s_Post]Traitor's Post[/url].

His default outfit is bandit furs, leather boots, and fur bracers. His starting weapons are a low-level bow, iron arrows, and a low-level dagger. He also carries random hunter items, some food and drink, and a small amount of gold. His NPC class is CombatRanger, and he prefers light armor, bows, and one-handed weapons. He is not essential (so you can kill him) and has a standard Nord male voice. His level ranges from 5-40 (player x 0.85) and he cannot be married.

No known incompatibilities. He has an idle marker near a tree stump, though (in Wilderness cell 38, 9) so something that rearranges that area too much might clip it or leave a gap.

This mod has been cleaned with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859]TES5Edit[/url].

If you find any bugs or incompatibilities, let me know in the comments!

Also available on the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=207727858]Steam Workshop[/url].

[b]-- Instructions (manual install) --[/b]

Download the zip, then unzip the esp and bsa files to your [i].../skyrim/Data/[/i] folder.

[b]-- Changelog --[/b]

See [i]Changes[/i] tab above.

[b]-- Notes --[/b]

This mod's filenames are [i]AoM_sacrificial-hunter.esp[/i] and [i]AoM_sacrificial-hunter.bsa[/i].

The Curious Hunter's base info in the Creation Kit is under [i]Actors → Actor → AoMSacrificialHunter[/i].

His BaseID is [i]xx000D62[/i] and his RefID is [i]xx00182A[/i] (replace [i]xx[/i] with whatever number this mod gets in your game; type [i]help "curious hunter"[/i] in the console to find it).
author: Aaron of Minneapolis
